snippet: Dr. Glasser, through “choice theory,” posited that people were in much more control of their lives than they realized in solving emotional and mental problems.
abstract: Dr William Glasser, a psychiatrist who published more than two dozen books promoting his view that mental health is mostly a matter of personal choice, dies at age 88.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Glasser, through “choice theory,” posited that people were in much more control of their lives than they realized in solving emotional and mental problems.

headline.main: William Glasser, 88, Doctor Who Said One Could Choose Happiness, Is Dead
headline.print_headline: William Glasser, 88, Doctor Who Said Mental Health Was a Choice, Is Dead
